title: Capacity Configuration

Capacity Configuration

Effective utilization of fulfillment centers is achieved by capacity configuration. To utilize fulfillment location for effective capacity management, consider the following:  

  • The order allocation to locations.
  • Restricting the order movement to locations which have reached the maximum capacity.
  • Remove locations that have reached capacity.
  • Capacity Utilization Level
  • Capacity Definition
  • Capacity Override
  • Site to Store Orders and Capacity
  • Prevent Capacity Consumption for BOPIS Orders

Capacity Utilization Level

This attribute defines the level at which the capacity is tracked for the location. Refer to the How to Enable Capacity for a Location section for details.

To configure capacity utilization level, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to Menu > Application Configuration > Manage Inventory Configuration > Inventory Location.
  2. On the Inventory Locations page, click Create or select the required configured location and click Edit. 
  3. On the Location Details page, enter the mandatory values for the location, such as Location ID, Display ID, Location Status ID, Location Type ID, and other necessary details.
  4. Enter the Capacity Utilization Level value and click Save.

Capacity Definition

The location capacity is defined at the day of the week and in shift level. Refer to the How to Enable Capacity for a Location section for details.

To configure capacity definition, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to Menu > Application Configuration > Manage Inventory Configuration > Inventory Location.
  2. On the Inventory Locations page, click Create or select the required configured location and click Edit. 
  3. On the Location Details page, enter the mandatory values for the location, such as Location ID, Display ID, Location Status ID, Location Type ID, and other necessary details.
  4. Expand the Capacity Definition section, click Add.
  5. In the Add dialog box, enter the day of week. The valid values are 1-7.

For example:

  • Day of the week (1) - Monday

  • Day of the week (2) - Tuesday

  • Day of the week (7) - Sunday

  1. Enter the start and end time for the location to accept orders. The start and end time follows 24-hour time format and accepts two decimal places.  

For example: To set the time from 9.00AM to 4.00 PM, enter the Start Time = 09.00 and End Time = 16.00.

  1. Enter maximum backlog and maximum capacity, and then click Submit.

Capacity Override

Capacity override functionality enables you to handle date exception scenarios when location, day, or shift is overridden. Refer to the How to Override the Capacity Definition section for details.

To configure capacity override, perform the following steps:

  1. To configure capacity override, perform the following steps:

  2. Navigate to Menu > Application Configuration > Manage Inventory Configuration > Inventory Location.
  3. On the Inventory Locations page, click Create or select the required configured location and click Edit. 
  4. On the Location Details page, enter the mandatory values for the location, such as Location ID, Display ID, Location Status ID, Location Type ID, and other necessary details.
  5. Expand the Capacity Override section, click Add.
  6. In the Add dialog box, enter the capacity override ID and the date for capacity override.
  7. Enter start and end time in HH.MM format for override. These are the required fields and cannot save capacity override without start and end time.
  8. Enter maximum backlog and maximum capacity, and then click Submit.

Site to Store Orders and Capacity

The Order Parameter Configuration provides ability for the retailers to enable or disable the reserve capacity at the inbound store for Site to Store pick up orders. Refer to the How to Configure Capacity Usage for Ship to Store Orders section for details.

To set the site to store capacity configuration, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to Menu > Application Configuration > Manage Order Configuration > Order Parameters
  2. Select the required parameter and click View.
  3. In the Details tab, select the Suppress capacity updates at pickup store for Ship to Store Orders check box to prevent capacity reservation for ship to orders at the receiving store. However, you can allow capacity reservation at the receiving store by clearing the Suppress capacity updates at pickup store for Ship to Store Orders check box.

 

Prevent Capacity Consumption for BOPIS Orders

The 'Capacity Consumption' Configuration provides the ability for the retailer to prevent capacity consumption for Buy Online Pickup at Store (BOPIS) orders at the organization level. However, users can still choose specific locations to consume capacity for BOPIS orders if necessary.

To configure the capacity consumption rule, perform the following steps:

  1. Navigate to Menu > Application Configuration > Manage Inventory Configuration > Capacity Consumption Rule
  2. On the Capacity Consumption Rule page, click Create to create a new configuration.
  3. Enter the Capacity Consumption Config Id.
  4. Select the Do not consume capacity for Buy Online Pickup in store orders check box to prevent retailers from consuming capacity for BOPIS orders, and then click Save.
  5. The retailers can still specify certain locations to consume capacity for BOPIS orders, and these can be specified in the exclusion list. To specify the exclusion list, click Excluded Locations, then click add. In the Add pop-up, select the location and click Submit.
